cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Drop 'Id' from both training and test sets
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_test = X_test.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
numerical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
categorical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numerical_imputer, numerical_columns),
        ('cat', Pipeline([
            ('imputer', categorical_imputer),
            ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first'))
        ]), categorical_columns)
    ]
)

# Create model pipeline
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42))
])

# Train the model
X_train_processed = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_val)
X_test_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_test)

model.fit(X_train_processed, train_df[target])

# Predict on validation set
y_val_pred = model.predict(X_val_processed)
val_r2 = r2_

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=[target])
X_test = test_df.copy()
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()
numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Drop 'Id' from training and validation sets (already present in X_train and X_val)
X_train = X_train.drop(columns=['Id'])
X_val = X_val.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Handle missing values
numerical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='median')
categorical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')

# Create preprocessing pipeline
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', numerical_imputer, numerical_columns),
        ('cat', Pipeline([
            ('imputer', categorical_imputer),
            ('onehot', OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore', drop='first'))
        ]), categorical_columns)
    ]
)

# Create model pipeline
model = Pipeline([
    ('preprocessor', preprocessor),
    ('regressor', RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42))
])

# Train the model
X_train_processed = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_val)
X_test_processed = preprocessor.transform(X_test)

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Separate features and target

X_test = test_df.copy()
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns

numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Drop 'Id' from training and validation sets

X_val = X_val.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Ensure all columns are properly defined

numerical_columns = [col for col in numerical_columns if col in X_train.columns]

categorical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')

# Create preprocessing pipeline

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

X_test = test_df.copy()
X_val = validation_df.drop(columns=[target])

# Identify categorical and numerical columns

numerical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()

# Drop 'Id' from training and validation sets

X_val = X_val.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Filter columns to ensure they exist

numerical_columns = [col for col in numerical_columns if col in X_train.columns]

categorical_imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='most_frequent')

# Create preprocessing pipeline

    transformers=[

)

# Create model pipeline

])
